result.name: idiom
result.notes: IDIOM is a web-based offender tracking tool, provided by the Home Office to police forces, to support Integrated Offender Management (IOM) arrangements. The system holds Police National Computer (PNC) data on arrests, charges, and courts and other outcomes for identified individuals (updated from PNC nightly). Users use the system to monitor the reoffending of their IOM programmes.

organization.name: home-office
organization.title: Home Office
organization.description:
The Home Office leads on immigration and passports, drugs policy, crime policy and counter-terrorism and works to ensure visible, responsive and accountable policing in the UK.

Home Office is a ministerial department, supported by 26 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/home-office

result.title: IDIOM

extras.value: This is a Restricted system, available only on the Criminal Justice Extranet (CJX). Since IDIOM holds mainly Police National Computer (PNC) data, any publication of data would need to be agreed with the PNC team.
